page.title: 14Hedges and Trees.
page.content: Hedges between fields are disappearing except mainly as farm boundaries, replaced by wire fencing, often electrical, for livestock. Laneside hedges survive. Most are closely trimmed annually between July and October. This year most trimming has been done by mid-August and blackberries and later wildflowers destroyed. Field hedges around 404309 have grown untrimmed with many standard trees developing. Some standards persist in fields, relics of removed hedges. Some saplings have been tagged in hedges (notably along lane 404308 to Kenwick Farm, and along lane at 437l7 - these are mainly Ash.)Ellesmere Road (427300-4l73300 hedges have several Elm standards, many dying of Dutch Elm disease. There are also Oak and Lime standards.
